Package Collecto

Class GridBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Collecto.GridBoard
  • public class GridBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the actual game board and handles all operations made on its attributes. It is mainly used by the Game class, and makes use of the Ball class.
    See Also:
    Game, Ball

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description

      Constructs a new GridBoard where the board attribute is set to be a provided custom board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GridBoard

        public GridBoard​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Ball>> customBoard)
        Constructs a new GridBoard where the board attribute is set to be a provided custom board.
        Parameters:
        customBoard - provided board to be used for this GridBoard

      • GridBoard

        public GridBoard()
        Calls GridBoard(boolean) with true boolean passed which constructs the GridBoard with a randomised board.
        See Also:
        construct()

      • GridBoard

        private GridBoard​(boolean construct)
        Constructor that creates a new GridBoard object without constructing a new board. This method is set to private because it it only used by the deepCopy() method to properly create a copy without causing infinite loops.
        Parameters:
        construct - whether board should be constructed

    • Method Detail

      • construct

        public void construct()
        Constructs a new valid pseudorandom 7*7 board and stores it in the board attribute of this GridBoard. It is used to generate a random new board whenever a new game is started, so that there is no way of knowing the board setup beforehand.

      • removeBalls

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ball> removeBalls​(Move move)
        Goes over the entire row or column in the direction of a given move, removes all balls that have neighbours of the same colour by calling the removeBalls(int, int) method and returning all removed balls in an ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        move - Move along which the removeBalls() method looks
        Returns:
        ArrayList of balls containing all removed balls

      • removeBalls

        private java.util.ArrayList<Ball> removeBalls​(int row,
                                              int column)
        Starts at the location on the board defined by row and column, selects that ball and looks whether there are neighbouring balls of the same colour. If there are, the method recursively moves on to those balls while removing and storing them, until all adjacent balls of the colour of the original ball are removed, and returns an ArrayList of all removed balls.

        This method should not be called directly, instead use removeBalls(Move).

        Parameters:
        row - row on the board where this method starts
        column - column on the board where this method starts
        Returns:
        all removed balls as an ArrayList of balls
        Requires:
        row and column to be between 0 and 7

      • deepCopy

        public GridBoard deepCopy()
        Creates and returns a new GridBoard object with copy of the board on which this method has been called on.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of this GridBoard

      • moveLine

        public void moveLine​(Move move)
        Moves all balls in a row or column to one side, where the line and direction are given in the provided move parameter.
        Parameters:
        move - move containing the direction and line to be moved
        Requires:
        isMoveValid(move) == true

      • getField

        public Ball getField​(int row,
                     int column)
        Retrieves a ball on a specified field.
        Parameters:
        row - row line number
        column - column line number
        Returns:
        Ball from a specified field, or null if an index is invalid
        Requires:
        validIndex(row) == true, validIndex(column) == true
        Ensures:
        index is valid

      • setField

        private void setField​(int row,
                      int column,
                      Ball ball)
        Puts a given ball on a specified field on the board.
        Parameters:
        row - index of the row of the ball
        column - index of the column of the ball
        ball - the specified ball to be set
        Requires:
        validIndex(row) == true, validIndex(column) == true

      • checkSurroundings

        public boolean checkSurroundings​(int row,
                                 int column)
        Checks the surroundings of a specified ball to see if any of the 4 adjacent balls in the cardinal directions are of the same colour or not.
        Parameters:
        row - row index
        column - column index
        Returns:
        false if no surrounding ball has the same colour as the ball specified by the indices, true if at least 1 surrounding colour matches the ball specified by the indices
        Requires:
        both validIndex(row) and validIndex(column) to be true
        Ensures:
        surroundings of specified fields are checked

      • isMoveValid

        public boolean isMoveValid​(Move move)
        Checks provided move for validness. Move is valid if it results in two balls of the same colour being next to each other when made.
        Parameters:
        move - new move being made
        Returns:
        true if a specified move is valid, false otherwise
        Requires:
        both validIndex(row) and validIndex(column) to be true

      • isMoveValid

        public boolean isMoveValid​(Move first,
                           Move second)
        Checks if a specified double move is valid. Double move is valid if it results in only second move being valid, which means that only second move should result in balls of the same colour being adjacent to each other.

        Check is being made by making both moves and checking the resulting move for validness by invoking the isMoveValidCheck(Move, GridBoard) method on the last move.

        Parameters:
        first - first move
        second - second move
        Returns:
        true if after making first move, second move is valid, false if second move is invalid

      • isMoveValidCheck

        private boolean isMoveValidCheck​(Move move,
                                 GridBoard copy)
        Checks provided move to be valid on provided board. Move is valid if it results in two balls of the same colour being next to each other when made.

        This method should not be called directly because it affects the board passed. Instead use isMoveValid(Move) or isMoveValid(Move, Move).

        Parameters:
        move - move made on the board along which the check takes place
        copy - copied board with the move made on it
        Returns:
        true if move is valid, false otherwise

      • possibleMoves

        public boolean possibleMoves()
        Calls possibleMoves(boolean) with a false boolean argument to check if there are any single or double moves possible on the board of this GridBoard object.
        Returns:
        true if there is possible move, false otherwise

      • possibleMoves

        public boolean possibleMoves​(boolean isSecondTime)
        Depending on parameter isSecondTime checks if there are any single moves possible on the board, or if there are any single or double moves possible on the board of this GridBoard object.
        Parameters:
        isSecondTime - boolean to define if check is for possibility of single or double moves
        Returns:
        true if there is a valid move within one or two moves, false if there are no valid moves possible within two moves
        Ensures:
        checks only a single move if isSecondTime is true, checks for single and double moves if isSecondTime is false

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides toString to instead return nice visual string of the board of this GridBoard built by TUI.boardString(GridBoard) using this GridBoard as a parameter.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of this GridBoard

      • getBoardString

        public java.lang.String getBoardString()
        Returns string representation of the board according to the project protocol. This protocol means that every ball on the board is represented by a number and placed in an array, where empty fields are represented as 0, and all numbers are separated by a delimiter as defined in Global.
        Returns:
        protocol representation of the board
